visual-communication

7,000 Times a Minute

7,000 Times a Minute* is a book on tattooing in Dublin. The book includes information on how tattooing works, interviews with people with tattoos and a photographic documentation of tattooing from start to finish. * A tattoo needle enters approximately 7,000 times a minute.

See project
visual-communication

The Gathering Demo Day 2013

Poster and invitation for the National Print Museum’s Demo Day as part of the Gathering 2013. All material was set and printed in the National Print Museum.

See project
visual-communication

Print and Design Table Quiz

Invitation, bookmarks and table numbers for the National Print Museum’s Print and Design Table quiz fundraiser, April 2013. All material was set and printed in the National Print Museum.

See project
textile-design

Mouds Bog

A collection of screen printed fashion fabric samples for Spring Summer 2016. The concept for this collection is based on the history of my family’s plot in Mouds Bog and the ban on turf cutting in private plots across Ireland. Fabrics used include cotton and silk. Processes include reactive paste,...

See project
textile-design

Modular Abstraction

A selection of screen printed and digitally printed interior fabric samples inspired by modular design. The samples were designed for light treatments, upholstery, cushions and curtains. Fabrics include linen, cotton, velvet and roman devore. Processes used include hand dying, pigment, etch, devore and digital print.

See project
visual-communication

Fail Big, Fail Better

Wood and metal type poster typeset in the National Print Museum. The poster was printed in the Science Gallery by members of the audience for their Fail Big event, part of their Fail Better exhibition. The audience member set their name into the poster without any guidance creating an individual...

See project
visual-communication

Bloomsday 2013

A souvenir print typeset and printed in the National Print Museum for Bloomsday 2013. Visitors were invited to print their own copy to take away.

See project
visual-communication

7,000 Times a Minute

§ 7,000 Times a Minute* is a book on tattooing in Dublin. The book includes information on how tattooing works, interviews with people with tattoos and a photographic documentation of tattooing from start to finish. * A tattoo needle enters approximately 7,000 times a minute.

See project
  • Gill Thorpe
  • +00 353 (0) 85 777 7777
  • hello@gillthrope.com

Living in Dublin, Ireland, I have recently graduated from the Textile and Surface Design degree course in NCAD. Previously graduating from Visual Communications at IADT, Dun Laoghaire, in 2012. I am very interested in craft based design and work with screen print, letterpress printing and weave. Please feel free to contact me about my work or any potential projects you may have.
